newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Ireland's Independent Newspapers says profit jumps.
newsitem.headline: Ireland's Independent Newspapers says profit jumps.

text.p: Ireland's Independent Newspapers Plc said Wednesday that a strong performance from all its businesses helped boost first half pre-tax profit by 28 percent to a record 26.02 million Irish punts ($41.8 million).
The media group, flagship company of Irish businessman and H.J. Heinz Co. Chief Executive Tony O'Reilly, has operations in Ireland, Britain, France, Australia, New Zealand and South Africa.
Independent, which prints and publishes more than 12 million newspapers a week, saw half-year revenues rise by nine percent to 182.5 million punts ($294 million) .
"We are very, very pleased with the results," Independent Chief Executive Liam Healy said in an interview.
The group's Irish operations, which recorded a 35 percent rise in operating profit, benefited from circulation gains and strong advertising income.
In Britain, the results of Newspaper Publishing were broadly in line with expectations and represented a significant improvement on 1995, Independent said in a statement.
Independent and Mirror Group each hold a 46 percent stake in Newspaper Publishing which reported a loss of 7 million pounds ($11 million) in the first half.
The Irish group said it hoped to see Newspaper Publishing, publisher of Britain's Independent and Independent on Sunday, return to profitability before the end of 1997.
